title: So what does smaller, but more frequent LUs mean for us?
body:
I feel like if there is to be changes in the way LU are presented, perhaps there should be a Nexus video/blog that openly discusses this major or possibly minor shift.  

I myself have never had any issue with the amount of lore we got per year, it always felt fair and evenly distributed. But I did think perhaps more for each champion would go a long way, however hearing that individual stories have a word limit kinda crushed that thought. But the prospects of re-visiting champions quicker sounds like a step in the right direction, although I'll have to see that first to believe it. 

What I really don't like is the idea of removing the mandatory bio+colour stories for each champion LU. I know that there is an apparent plan to re-visit the Noxian champs this year, for both those that were missed recently and those who only had bio updates. But like I said already I dont like the bare minimum amount of lore each champion got from previous years and I really cant appreciate updating Leblanc, Kata & Darius without there own colour story. Even if Darius is "fine" because he had the comic already (even tho that really shouldn't be a replacement)  and narrative are only holding back on Kata because of spoils for a future Du Couteau story. Regardless my point is, I really hope the tap isn't being put on permanent drip, meaning quicker updates but with less in them. 

Am I being paranoid and rash in my thoughts? Quite obviously yes, which is exactly why I would have hoped for a Nexus blog to clear things up. I even said in the past before even gameplay/blalance started doing blogs discussing their aspirations for season 8, there could be one from the narrative team as well. Even if narrative cant make promises, something to discuss more about would be better.

replies.body:
Hi!

So there is an upcoming Nexus post that talks more about behind the scenes of the writing folks, but until then (and understanding that it's a more broad post, rather than a specifically focused answer) - what do you suggest as an alternative?  I'm genuinely interested to kick about some ideas with you folks to see what you feel would be better, and what the pros and cons of each possible solution are acceptable or no.

For example - you say that you're not a fan of the LUs that don't come with a color story, but that the total amount of lore per year is ok.  With the recent Noxus faction update, we got the main champ of the update (Swain) with a bio and color story, but a selection of other champs only got new bios.  There was a faction story too, ofc.

It's a _terrible*_ way to measure it, but hypothetically, **if you had a budget of the same total number of words per year, how would you allocate them?**

######*But really, it's an abstraction well beyond usefulness, but at least it means we can all talk to each other in this thread in relative terms.  So that's something I guess??

Was the Star Guardian story from last year handled by the same team that does the rest of the writing? Not that I didn't enjoy it, but having a 33-min short story dedicated to an alternate universe when some champions miss out on bios and color stories for their faction updates feels like resources could be allocated a little differently (not to mention characters like Syndra have a more fleshed out Star Guardian bio than they do an actual bio).

So, there's a Narrative discipline (same as there's an Art or Design or Engineering etc. discipline) and you have folks like writers and editors and stuff in that discipline.  An individual Rioter (from the Narrative discipline) may be assigned to various teams - like Promo or Champ or PIE (I think it's called PIE - the skins++ team) or Worldbuilding or whatever.  

A writer from the Narrative discipline had already been assigned to the PIE team, and that team as a whole decided that the best use of their writer's skills was to create the Star Fall story.  It wasn't written by someone who was on the Champ or Worldbuilding team if that's what you mean.  

Does that help?

Personally I'm ok with them focusing on the bios first and on the color stories later,if this means that we'll get more bios this year than in the last one.
After all the bios are the more important part of the champ,as they give the champ their background and solidify their place in the world,while most color stories are just there to add some flavor,which is nice,but not as important as the bio.

Well the only way I'd personally be contempt without mandatory colour stories. Would be if they extended the ~~100~~ 600 max word limit on biographies. Otherwise nah that shit is too short to be satisfactory in my books and there are some pretty convoluted / complex champions in this game.

However I dont think they plan to withdraw for colour stories or anything, but even holding them off for a time being still feels uninspiring.

The 100-word limit is only for short bios within the LoL client, and on the champion's landing page on Universe. All champs now have 100-word bios, which we can update and amend as the character gets more story.

But not all of them have full bios beyond that, on Universe. Not by a long stretch. The Noxus update tackled four full bios, one color story and one longer short story (plus artwork captions and general Noxus info) - just for context, this is in addition to all the other content that Riot is producing at any given time, and our Narrative Rioters might be tied up elsewhere.

Every champion will get a short bio, a long bio, and a color story... eventually.

Right now, the feedback we're getting from the majority of players, worldwide, is that the full bios should be of a consistent length, depth and writing quality. We will only commit to a level of output that we can sustain at a suitable quality bar, and it's my job to make sure we don't fall below that. We shouldn't rush to release content we don't believe will inspire and excite players, just to check boxes on a list! ;-P

(Again, for context, this happened on the Noxus update - a writer and I agreed that an additional color story was not going to be finished to the appropriate level of quality in time for the update, so we did not go ahead with it. You will all get to see it later, once we circle back and redraft it.)

We will still tell stories, and we will do so more regularly than we ever have before. Watch this space.

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=E6AvdyKU,comment-id=000000000001,timestamp=2018-02-14T23:26:19.776+0000)
>
> We will still tell stories, and we will do so more regularly than we ever have before. Watch this space.

Where have we heard this promise before?  Hmmm...
You've never heard this promise from _me_ before. ;-)

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=E6AvdyKU,comment-id=00000000000100000000,timestamp=2018-02-14T23:37:38.700+0000)
>
> You've never heard this promise from _me_ before. ;-)

As the English say, the proof is in the pudding...

Hey, guys!  I came up with a new skin idea for Zac!

It's actually "The proof of the pudding is in the eating"...

And pudding means dessert, so I don't know what to believe anymore.

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=E6AvdyKU,comment-id=0000000000010000000000000000,timestamp=2018-02-15T06:03:30.432+0000)
>
> It's actually "The proof of the pudding is in the eating"...
> 
> And pudding means dessert, so I don't know what to believe anymore.

I thought "pudding" was some kind of sausage.  I love Blood Pudding, but I wouldn't want it for dessert.  :)

Also, I believe the statement means "Put up or shut up," as my less cultured 'Murikan friends would say.

So, you've _already_ promised a definitive update on Soraka, more care about changing champions than the Varus team had, AND a faster cadence for stories.  Quite the list of promises there, my friend.

Let's make a new saying: "Put up that blood-sausage, or shut the pudding proof!"

Now THAT's what I call Transatlantic cooperation :-)

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=E6AvdyKU,comment-id=000000000001000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-02-15T17:29:04.156+0000)
>
> Let's make a new saying: "Put up that blood-sausage, or shut the pudding proof!"
> 
> Now THAT's what I call Transatlantic cooperation :-)

It's a bit lewd, but what the hell.

(Heh, "blood sausage."  ( ͡º ͜ʖ ͡º) )

So in previous years, more often then not, lore updates were paired with a special release- either a VGU or on the rare occasion a new champion. But now if you guys apparently want to revisit recently updated regions and/or champions, does that mean LUs will begin to occur without the need of a special release to go with it? Much like how there was 4 separate comic-based updates, then both Varus and Annie's LU. All of which were standalone releases.

For further example, we know you guys want to finish of the remaining Noxian champs (and possibly revisit some of the already updated ones) this year. Does that mean when you do release more Noxus lore will it have to wait upon a new champ/rework release first or is it intended to be a standalone update? Are you even allowed to answer that?

Well Annie and Varus both got big lore updates without any special releases,not to mention the comics that we got last year,so I think it is possible for us to get group updates without a big release.

Alternatively they might simply give us lore updates with special releases more frequently.
Last year we had 3 group lore updates that came with special releases(zaun,Demacia and the vastaya)

Assuming that we'll get ~9 big releases this year(counting new champs and full VGUs),then they could give us small lore updates with all(or at least almost all) of these.

So the upcoming Void champ could come with a few void lore updates,Irelia and Akali could both come with small ionia updates and maybe later this year we could get a new noxus champ,that comes with more Noxus lore,explaining why they plan to revisit Noxus this year.
Thanks but I'm already well aware of everything you just explained. It's that very awareness that drove me to ask.

I won't say too much, because I don't want to spoil some cool surprises... but of the wishlist of content that we have for Narrative this year, lore updates linked to new stuff AND also lore updates not linked to new stuff are both on the table.

Scathlocke, I'm perfectly aware that you will probably ignore me, but the pleasant surprises only seem to be for fans of your "main" characters. When the lore team has clear favorites and disregards everyone else (regardless of popular demand) a lot of us feel it's hard to connect to the lore.

It's really discouraging to know that you have nothing to look forward to in League.

Nothing, ever...? ;-)

Can you give me some examples? I'm guessing Vladimir, for starters!

You guys make a lot of awesome things, but in the end that's not what keeps me coming back. League is full of creativity and surprises but then so is my Steam library. When a champion, regardless of the dated/subpar execution of their awesome concept (quoting Reav3 on this one) is right up your alley and you end up having a history with them, that's when the magic happens. Most other things pale in comparison. A connection like that can make or break your interest in Runeterra.

And Vlad fans (some of them have left League in recent years) have had plenty of reasons to despair for the future of their involvement lately.

1) To start with, we got hit with one of the biggest retcons during the short lore update. Despite that, we got no consecutive lore that replaced the old one or gave us any insight as to why the retcon even happened. His current bio page even mentions the High Command, which is no longer canon (according to Interlocutioner). (To clarify, I'm cool with the retcon and apologize for being angry over it. But give us something to fan about, don't just leave us with nonexistent/contradictory lore.)

2) We have no guarantee that the next Noxus lore update will change that. From what I judge by your and Interlocutioner's posts it will mainly focus on Swain's relationship with the Blood Brothers (as if they don't have plenty of content already).

3) This is despite dozens of people asking for Vlad lore on these very boards, despite me posting questions and [stupidly intricate theories](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/TLG6WjbK-speculation-the-female-darkin-blood-magic-romanjewishwod-mythology) for two years now (and all of this getting highly upvoted). Surely George R. R. Martin isn't the only guy who considers blood mages interesting enough to write about? The dismissal and apathy makes people feel unwelcome.

Sorry if I wrote too much. I hope you find at least some of it useful or enjoyable. A more general point is, I think, that some champions are reader bait and their fans will be lore-inclined, so if you give them nothing else at least give them good lore.

Anyway thanks for reading! Musical greeting:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6cfmXHWYYXE

This kind of feedback is always welcome, thank you for sharing! :-)

I would say, please don't take Vlad's absence from the first faction update of 2018 as any kind of snub, or that he's a victim of favoritism. We've got nothing against blood magic, either...

You highlight something that's very important to me, though - that many of our champions have a dissonance in their presented lore, in that there are inconsistencies between the short and full bios. We need to fix that.

I have a question, though: would you rather we had rushed out something for Vlad, or take our time to produce something bigger/better in future...? ;-P I've no idea what you're referring to in (2), though. Could you elaborate? I don't believe either myself or Interlocutioner have spoken officially about a second Noxus update, yet?

Regarding 2): This was a [comment by Ant in Oz.](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/vJoMWjvO-new-noxus-lore-lads-get-hyped?comment=00060004). My speculation about the upcoming update's contents was based on comments by you and Interloc.

> I would say, please don't take Vlad's absence from the first faction update of 2018 as any kind of snub, or that he's a victim of favoritism. We've got nothing against blood magic, either...

Of course I wouldn't say you dislike him - he just doesn't inspire you very much. But this isn't true for everyone - there's both fans of Vlad's concept and fans of the vampire archetype who were looking forward to updates. Regarding your question:

> I have a question, though: would you rather we had rushed out something for Vlad, or take our time to produce something bigger/better in future...?

Why is it Vlad fans that have to make this choice and not the other fanbases? The mess of his current lore, the general lack of content, the popular demand and the high popularity ingame he's been enjoying  - aren't those things that warrant prioritisation?

That said of course I would choose the latter, but there's no guarantee of it.

On a bigger scale there will always be fans of the high fantasy vampire genre, because the themes are as old as civilisation and will outlive most of us. There will always be some player demand for the "Crimson King of the Night" (sorry) fantasy, and do you just want to continue telling these people to pack their bags and get involved in some other fandom, because this one isn't for them?

As before, thanks for reading, considering and answering. It means a lot that you come here to discuss despite the negativity you are met with. 


~~PS Vlad is still a human dark wizard with gothic themes, but that kind of falls in the vampire archetype?~~

While there is a post saying that the next update would focus a bit on how Noxus is run and how its military works(though thats not even the post you linked),it also says that they want to adress a wide range of champions next time around.

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/vJoMWjvO-new-noxus-lore-lads-get-hyped?comment=00090001

And isn't it kinda obvious why they prioritized the other noxian champs over Vlad this time around?Swain got the VGU, Darius is one of the 3 leaders of Noxus(and LB most likely too) and Katarina is one of the most iconic champs of the entire game,leaving her out would have been like leaving Garen out of the Demacia update.


Also I feel like you are a bit overreacting here.
Yes Vlad didn't receive a lore update since the retcon(except for the new short bio),but the same goes for a lot of other champs too.
Just look at {{champion:12}} {{champion:31}} {{champion:17}} {{champion:45}}  {{champion:96}} {{champion:85}} {{champion:5}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:143}} {{champion:54}} {{champion:42}} {{champion:91}} {{champion:37}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:90}} {{champion:38}} {{champion:68}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:63}} {{champion:111}} {{champion:76}} etc. (heck {{champion:223}} & {{champion:432}} never even had a full lore to begin with)

They simply can't give every champ a lore update at once.
And at least in Vlads case we got a bit of backstory about blood magic in the Varus comic and he was involved in the Sion reprogramming,the champs I listed above didn't even get that.

Take a look here:
https://nexus.leagueoflegends.com/en-us/2018/02/narrative-in-2018/

I hope that will give more info and context! :-)

That would depend on whether we had a new release to align with...

Give me a few minutes. I can provide more insight.

Just to clarify - I'm pretty sure Shantzilla meant... THIS update was about the military and how Noxus is run. We will return to address other Noxus champs in future. And these are the kinds of lore beats we'll be addressing in 2018.

That's three separate points, not one :-)

But I can see how it looks otherwise. We (Narrative) should clarify. Let me get right on it, watch this space.
If you were to update more Noxian champs, what would the thematic be?
Riven is a favorite, as well as Draven, and they don't have updates.

Both of them were considered for the Noxus update, but we only had a limited number of writers available and had to prioritise accordingly.

I would hope that we can get around to them soon, as the majority of the groundwork was already done. :-)
I understand the Trifarix, but why Katarina for an update? Why give her a rocky relationship with her father?

Most likely because Katarina used to be and still is one of the most iconic champs of the entire game.
There was a time where she was present in pretty much every piece of official art.

There's also the theme that she serves Noxus first and foremost (like Darius) because her family ties are now... slightly shaky. ;-) Also, her lore was ooooooooold, and she is one of the most iconic champions, as you pointed out.

There were other champs on the wishlist, as I said. We kept going until we ran out of time. We will come back to them.

He tried to have her killed. That's going to make family holidays awkward, at the very least... :-P

Expect to see dangling story threads tugged again. We only leave them dangling for a reason, now.

So why give her a rocky relationship with her father? I'm not complaining, since it gives her and Talon some friction, but now I want to know more about their family dynamic. How does she feel about her family in general now?

I'm not saying they should abandon the color stories completely,I just think it is ok if they decide to do the bios first and then add the missing color stories once they have done the bios of all the other champions.

I mean they did say that they want to revisit Noxus again this year,so lets assume that said second update is going to be similar in scope to the first one and would update just as much champions.
Would you prefer it if they added 3 color stories to Lb,Darius and Katarina or would you prefer it if they instead added bios to 3 Noxus champs who wouldn't get a lore update at all otherwise?
Well you can understand the fear that they'll fall short of that goal, leaving us with even less lore.

The thing is that,like Bioluminescence said,they have only a limited amount of workforce.

If they focus said work force on updating bios and color stories,then we'd get updates for less champions than if they focus that workforce only on the bios.

In a more simplified way:
If they have the workforce to write 1000 words for a lore update,where every lore piece is 100 words long(of course that word amount isn't realistic,it is only an example)
They could use this workforce to either make 10 bios and no color stories,or they could use it to make 5 bios and 5 color stories.

And I'd like the 10 bio-option more.


Of course I am also worried that we won't get enough of these smaller lore updates to make up for their small size,but that is an entirely different matter.

I would like to think (yes, optimism is what I'm using) that more frequent means that they're evening out cadence.  As in, they could potentially hit the same amount they've been hitting, but more distributed.  That way, if they're moving slowly (amount they've given out last year) it will not feel like there's a huge gap or pause in overall lore building.  That way, we have a consistent stream of info to dig into, even if it's not as heavy of a load as we're use to.

On the other hand, if it turns out that we do get more than the usual loads we have, then it'll feel like the world is being built at a quicker pace because there's not huge gaps between any one topic of background info.  Even if it goes from Noxus to Freljord to Targon back to Noxus, the wait time won't feel too bad since we aren't waiting as long between any story or champ update period.

The word count is understandable, they should have mentioned it earlier. But overall the revisit seems like it will be slow. In fact, champions like Ekko took over a year to get their color stories. Honestly not a fan of some now some later, not a lot of people will be willingly to wait once they know how long it could take. 

If they plan to revisit Zaun's lore and actually hit some key points like Jinx/Vi mystery or Piltover's C maybe feel enthusiastic? I just don't like how they just throw a little out there just to be relevant. It leads me to think just like you're stating in this thread; worried. But they've done it long enough now so they don't plan on changing. Things are still tied to releases because idk and lore just takes to long to be delivered. Well the actual lore we want to know, not about a new kingdom in the Noxian empire.

I think you're expected to have thoughts like that.
